name: cppcheck-lite2
description: A minimalistic VS Code extension that runs cppcheck on C/C++ files upon save and shows issues in the Problems panel. compile_commands.json and .cppcheck-config files are used to configure Cppcheck.
author: Emiel Estiévenart

cppcheck-lite2.enable.description: Enable or disable the Cppcheck Lite2 extension.

cppcheck-lite2.minSeverity.description: Minimum severity of issues to report (info, warning, or error).

cppcheck-lite2.path.description: Path to the cppcheck executable. If empty, uses 'cppcheck' from the system PATH.

cppcheck-lite2.whole_program_checking.description: By default, Cppcheck is run in such a way that only the current file is checked. If this setting is enabled, the whole program is checked.

cppcheck-lite2.build_directory.description: Path to the build directory. If empty, uses the workspace root/Cppcheck-lite2-build

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
